135.title: Other Options

choices: Peace is established: Both race coexist and thrive together
Peace is not established: Wolf/Human relations differ vastly according to region
Peace is not established: Both species are plunged into an all out war.
1352.content:
In a very bold move to appear less menacing and alien to these furless creatures, the wolves opted to dump their advanced weaponry and equipment. They downgraded to equipping weapons and gear more in line with the technological developments of 10,000 BC earth.

The first contact is perhaps the most important event in the shared history of both races, depending on what the first impressions are, the rest of history will change drastically.
1352.title: Still in 10,000 BC

13522.content:
The initial peace talks didn't go well. Despite the wolves best attempts to establish peace, the humans were far too weary and suspicious to establish an effective and long lasting peace. The distrust of the humans did little to stop the wolves from, spreading around the whole planet, colonizing large parts of it. The wolves were adapting frighteningly fast, adopting the human tradition of using names, quickly getting used to the flora and fauna of their respective region, putting the planet's rich and up to now untapped resources to good use, by creating iron and bronze spears for hunting and defending against human raiders. Now 100 years after the first encounter, the wolves have established several tribes and clans all around the earth, each differing vastly from the others.

The IronClaw Clan
Leader: General Vvulf
Numbers: 450,000 wolves 150,000 humans(emergency rations)
Info: This tribe roams the lush forests of central Europe. many wolves opted to follow General Vvulf because he is the descendant of the Supreme pack leader. Sadly he inherited none of his father's tolerance and hospitality, he trains his followers into becoming bloodthirsty warriors and he treats humans as nothing more than annoying pests and emergency food supply. They live in medieval like villages, surrounded by wooden, spike walls

Winter's Children
Leader: Kein Jokien
Numbers: 75,000 dire wolves 450,000 humans
info: The Winter's children reside in the northern parts of Asia, Europe and north America. These wolves have evolved larger in size, and their furs have become thicker and fluffier as to accommodate for the cold and snow. The humans and wolves of this land are forced to work together in order to survive. They live in houses made out of ice blocks. While they usually respect each other, fights are not a rare occurrence, even if the victor is obvious.

The Prairie Dogs
Leader: Tallulah Ama
Numbers: 50,000 wolves 350,000 humans
Info: This nomadic tribe roams the lush fields of north America. They are very tolerant and despite the name they consist of both humans and wolves. They live in makeshift, easy to pack up tents.

SO! Which tribe will you follow?
13522.title: The Wolves separate

135221.content: Are you one of the sneering, imperialist wolves living there or are you a very, very unfortunate human.
135221.title: IronClaw

1352211.content:
Name: General Vvulf
Views on humans: Pathetic Snacks
Gender: Male
Bio: General Vvulf is one of the four children of the supreme pack leader. After his father's death he seized the throne and then he exiled his three other brothers. no one knows what became of them, but Vvulf doesn't care as long as they stay out of his way. Vvulf has only hatred towards his father. Vvulf sees him as a gullible fool for trying to establish peace with the human, which he sees as lesser creatures, he even went so far as to rename himself to Vvulf as to forget the name his father gave him. He has gone to great lengths to erase his father from history, as not to taint his own legacy. He made it illegal to mention his old name and his father, but the elders from other tribes often tell tales of the achievements of the Supreme Pack leader.

Are you him or another wolf
1352211.title: The General

13522111.content:
Vvulf sat in his chair. His guards lined around the room, ready to protect him, to the death if need be.

In front of him, stood a formidable foe.

Vvulf had dealt with a number of adversaries, and had plenty of trophies from each encounter; teeth, claws, a few heads, and some tails. Others, of course, had ended up as fat that he'd had to work off.

None of this impressed this particular foe.

Countless scars covered Vvulf's body, and weapons hung all over the walls. There were plenty of stories about his victories, ready to be recited at a moment's notice.

None of this caused any emotion in this foe.

Vvulf looked at his foe.

His foe was....
13522111.title: General Vvulf

choices: An Ambassador from Another Pack Arrives
He goes to see to his Mate/s
135221111.content:
A Lore Keeper stood before General Vvulf.

Vvulf looked at the Lore Keeper.

The Lore Keeper looked at him.

Vvulf was of the Assault Genotype.

The Lore Keeper was of the Infiltrator Genotype.

In a fair fight, Vvulf would easily win.

This was not a fair fight, for it was Law Versus Lore.

Vvulf wrote the law, and could change it at any time he liked.

The Lore Keepers wrote the Lore, and never changed it.

Vvulf could kill anyone. He'd eaten five thieves this morning.

The Lore Keepers could erase his name, and his achievements.



"What do you want?" Vvulf asked, eventually.

"To know the reasoning behind your punishment of the five thieves this morning, Flowing Stream," the Lore Keeper said.

Vvulf growled. "That name is not to be uttered in my presence!"

"It is the name that your father, Simple Hunter, gave you," said the Lore Keeper.

"That name too." Vvulf growled once more.

"It is still in the Lore," the Lore Keeper said.

Vvulf muttered to himself.

"Your reasoning for the punishment?"

"They stole food," Vvulf said. "They claimed that they were hungry. Well, I was hungry too." He patted his belly. "Not any more." He glanced at a human servant, who was busy cleaning the floor. "These pathetic snacks know better than to steal from me, don't they, Snack?"

"Yes Master," the human said, still cleaning. "We're just snacks."

The Lore Keeper looked at Vvulf. "That's your justification: that you were hungry?"

Vvulf looked at him. "Yes. Do you have a problem with that?"

"Simple Hunter would have only executed them if they were dangerous to the Pack," said Lore Keeper. "He would of had those thieves work for their meal. Even the other Packs would have come up with a better reason."

"Please, spare me of this nonsense," said Vvulf. "The Jungle Hounds sacrifice humans to their so-called god, and the Anubians do a number of other things."

"True, but at least the sacrifices tend to be volunteers in the case of the Jungle Hounds, and the number of Anubians that abuse humans is fairly small," said the Lore Keeper. "You are a Pack Leader. You set an example for others to follow. I wonder how things would be if there was a different Pack Leader, like one of your brothers, or their sons?"

Vvulf growled. "Don't you dare mention them!"

The Lore Keeper looked at him. "It is the Lore: A Pack Leader can be Challenged if deemed unfit to lead. Relatives have first chance, followed by fellow Pack Members, and then Outsiders."

Vvulf looked at a number of heads he had hung over him. "Then let those that try, see what will happen to them."

"Such will be your fate, if the Challenger was to win," said the Lore Keeper. "Your father was a respected Pack Leader; he even stepped down as Supreme Pack Leader when we did settle upon this world. Even those who hated, and disagreed with him, and his policies, respected him as a Leader. I wonder what he would think of you?"

Vvulf growled, as the Lore Keeper turned, and left the room. He wanted to kill the Lore Keeper, but such an act was punishable by a fate worse than death itself - his name would be erased from the Lore. It was worse than being considered a Villain, or an Idiot that needed to learn a Lesson, in a story. Better to have a negative type of fame, than none at all.

"Is that all for the day?" he asked.
135221111.title: A Lore Keeper

choices: Vvulf orders the Snack to rub his feet
Vvulf orders the Snack to rub his belly
Vvulf orders the Snack to run.
1352211114.content:
Vvulf looked at a scribe, who was consulting the list of those who had petitioned to see him. "I'm waiting."

"None of any real importance, Pack Leader Vvulf," the scribe, a Basic Infantry type, said. "At least, not until the evening."

"Then assign delegation of those meetings to those competent enough to discuss whatever needs discussing," said Vvulf. "The last few visitors were nothing but a waste of my time!" He looked around the hall, seeing who would dare to challenge his words.

His eyes soon settled upon one of his Head Captains.

The Captain looked at him, and then glanced at the others nearby. He then looked back at him. "Permission to speak, Pack Leader Vvulf?"

Vvulf made a gesture, indicating his approval. "Speak."

"Thank you," the Head Captain said. "Granted the previous Lesser Pack Leaders' Ambassadors and the like might have been more than a little tedious with their information, the matter is this; the pack is having some serious difficulties."

"Explain," said Vvulf.

"The resistance that certain humans are engaged in seems to be more widespread than what you might wish to believe, with more joining them on a regular basis," said Head Captain. "Likewise, it seems that even members of the Pack itself are dissatisfied with your leadership, even working with the human resistance groups, in one manner or another. Likewise the continual conquests seems to be stretching our forces and resources, making dealing with the resistance difficult at best. There's also the fact that the other Packs are starting to take defensive military action, even arming and training humans, rather effectively I might add."

"Get to the point," said Vvulf.

"Pack Leader Vvulf, I know you don't like the idea, but perhaps it might be a good idea to engage in some reforms, in regards to certain policies," said Head Captain. "As the Lore Keeper stated, people will Challenge you if they deem you unfit to lead."

Vvulf tapped his claws on the end of his armrest. "I shall think about your advice." He then stood up. "If I am not needed, I'll be in my room. Send me a Snack, preferably a female one."

"Yes, Pack Leader," came the response.



A while later, Vvulf was in his room, sipping on some fermented fruit juices. They had been rather tasty this year. He looked up as the curtain separating his room from the rest of the place was opened, and in came a young female Snack.

"You wished to see me, Pack Leader?" she asked, fearfully. To say that Vvulf was a difficult master to please was an understatement. She'd seen what had happened to the five food thieves that morning - they had merely stolen some food, only to have been eaten themselves. It wasn't like they'd been shown any sort of mercy either, like getting their necks broken beforehand, but rather had been tied up, and swallowed whole and alive.

Vvulf gestured with a finger. There was a look on his face, one that most would fear, if they had any sort of sense.

The Snack knew the look, and felt even more afraid. "What do you wish of me?"

Vvulf grinned. He knew what he wanted.

The Snack wished that the Pack Leader was angry instead. She knew what the Pack Leader wanted.
1352211114.title: Criticism, and a Snack

135223.content: Are you a wolf or a human?
135223.title: Prairie Dogs

1352231.content:
Name: Takoda Hopi
Views on humans: equals
Gender: Male
Bio: Takoda's mother died on the day he was born due to complications with the birth. His father died a month later due to a hunting accident. The orphaned wolf, just a couple of weeks old was adopted by Sika Cherooke, the pack's shaman. From a very early age, Takoda showed interests in becoming a shaman himself. Sika gladly taught his adoptive son how to treat wounds with medicinal herbs, how to predict floods and droughts and how to communicate with the spirit world. While adept at healing, Takoda still has a lot to learn about communing with spirits.

Are you him or another wolf?
1352231.title: The shaman's aprentice

13522311.content:
Takoda was sitting in a large tent. It was chief Tallulah Ama's tent so of course it was bigger then most. It was comprised out of two rooms, both separated with a piece of hanging cloth. The first room was a living room of sorts with a dim fireplace in the middle and several logs around it meant to be used as chairs. The other room was the chief's private quarters, where Takoda's father and the chief were discussing something.

This was not unusual, the chief Tallulah would often consult his shaman before he made an important decision. But this time the chief insisted that Takoda came too, which was the unusual bit since Takoda was considered too young to be a proper advisor.

To pass the time while he was waiting for his father and the chief to finish their discussion, Takoda admired the fine material from which the tent was made. He was about to get lost in the intricate designs on the cloth, when a furry paw pushed aside the veil between both rooms.

Forth came Tallulah, the assault genotype, then came Sika, who was an infiltrator genotype, his fur covered in tribal paint. Both of them quietly walked over to the small firepit and sat down on the logs, standing oppositely of Takoda. The eerie silence was broken by chief Tallulah, who spoke in a calm voice.

"Takoda, me and your father have a very important matter to discuss with you..."
13522311.title: An important discussion

135223112.content:
"5 days ago a human messenger from our eastern tribes arrived. He rejected our offerings of food and water, he refused to enter our village or come within five meters of anyone else. He stated that he had urgent and important matters to discuss with the chief and the shaman of our tribe. We obliged and we met up on the outskirts of our village, again he stated that we were to not get near him." the chief explained.

"When we met him i was surprised by the horrible state of his body. His skin was pale and wrinkly, his entire body was covered in a painful looking blue rash. He had a piece of cloth covering his mouth and most of his head, so i couldn't get a good look at his face, but his eyes were bloodshot. He said that s plague has ravaged the lands to the east, infecting and killing hundreds. He stated that he was send by his chief in order to warn the other tribes." the chief said.

"I then offered him medical help, but he insisted that his tribe had already tried everything and that it was too late for him." Sika explained "Once he had delivered his message he simply walked away and disappeared into the sunset." He finished.

"We have dealt with diseases before but not something like this. According to the messenger's description this disease is brutally efficient and quick at killing it's host, far too much so to be natural. This has lead me to believe that this is a disease not only of the body, but of the soul." the shaman said. "I suspect that a malevolent spirit has created this plague. In order to find a cure you must venture into the spirit realm and seek out the evil spirit who conjured this plague." he continued.

"B-but why me? You're much more experienced with spirits, dad." Takoda said.

"That may be true, but i need to stay here and tend to the sick, if the plague were to reach us before you find the cure. You have learned a lot along the years my son, and you are still young and full of energy." Sika said.

"Oh, and lest we forget. We had a special tool made for just this occasion." the chief said. He then went back to his room, and returned with a finely crafted Tomahawk. "Normal weapons cannot hurt spirits, but this one is special. The handle is made from the branch of a thousand year old tree, the blade has been enchanted thrice and the feather strapped to it belonged to a Thunderbird. Wieled it with great care, young Takoda." The chief said as he handed the Tomahawk to the young wolf.

After thanking him for the gift, Takoda turned to his father and said. "I am ready for the journey."

"I believe in you son. Now let's hurry, time is of the essence. I will lead you to the spirit world" Sika said...
135223112.title: "A plague is threatening our lands..."

135224.content:
The other clans

The Anubians
Leader: Ammon Jabari
Numbers: 125,000 jackals 700,000 humans(thralls, servants and slaves)
Info: The Anubians have set up base in the arid African deserts. in order to cope with the extreme conditions, the wolves here have evolved a jackal like appearance. Due to their new appearance, the many humans think of them as being descendants of the god Anubis, and as such they flock to their villages in order to serve them. They live in large and impressive cities, with buildings made out of limestone. While most Anubians respect their human thralls, many of them tend to abuse the human's willingness to please...

The Jungle Hounds
Leader: Chief Negwatu
Numbers: 17,500 wolves 30,000 humans
info: This tribe of wolves lives in the Amazonian rain forest. The human and wolf tribes in south america generally live separate, but they have established trade routes and will help each other if they need.They worship Citrah the sun god, and often pay tribute to him. They live in large stone temples, similar to aztecs.

The Corpse Eaters
Leader: Thek Dustpaw
Numbers: 75,000 Hyenas 10,000 humans(mainly traders, residing temporarily)
info: These wolves have evolved to resemble hyenas. They lead a similar lifestyle scavenging carrions for meat. Typically acting aggressive or plucky, they see neighboring human tribes as competition rather than enemies or allies. They live in tents made out of sticks and tanned animal skin.
135224.title: Other Clans

1352243.content:
In the Savannah, life is cheap and very primitive. Out here, stone and fire are the height of technology for Hyenas and Men. Thek is not a cruel chief, but a pragmatic one, the borders between the hut cities of his clan and the fire pits of humans are clear, and only the ones who are to trade may enter unharmed. Because of their fur, they need no clothes, allowing them to dedicate a large quarter of their workers to gathering food, rather than making fabrics.

The Council of Five Fires is the alliance between the human tribes who live closes their to the hyenas, but they are denied the knowledge of their neighbors, forced to scrape a living in lean-to's or beneath the open sky. Most humans have forgone clothing to be more like the hyenas, hoping to be seen as more civilized than those who would wage war, now only the tribes of the badlands along the desert wear anything anymore. And the badlands lead raids against the humans they see as traitors, and the hyenas who've forced them there.

Because of the influx of the hyenas, food is hard to come by in sufficient quantities, so the dead are often cannibalized for food, even the humans have been forced to turn to the dead for survival. It's the dry season now, and the herds haven't migrated thought the plains this year, everyone is hungry, but only time will tell how it goes.

Are you lowly human? Or noble hyena?
1352243.title: The Corpse Eaters

choices: Obah finds food on the way to the border
She finds nothing on the way to the border
13522432.content:
Obah was a huntress/scavenger who lived under the Council of Five Fires, waking up today, she rubbed her aching belly, it'd been a few sunrises since her last good meal. "Or anyone's good meal." She added to herself, watching as the rest of her camp woke up, her pup was busy gnawing on a thigh bone from a few days ago. With her mate dead, he'd been eaten by the camp, and his thigh was all that had kept her pup fed these last few sunrises, but once again, they were out of food. And he was too old now to take her milk, not that she was milking anymore, what with the lack of food, and her pup had to start eating solids quicker than most, at least he took to it well.

Standing up and stretching, she idly scratched her thigh as she walked over to her pup and grabbed him from behind, tickling him. "Who's my big, strong hunter?" She laughed as he tried desperately to get away without dropping the bone.

"I am! I am!" He laughed, managing to squirm his way out of his mother she arms, plopping on his behind in the dusty ground. "You gonna hunt today momma?" He asked, hearing her stomach growl while she tickled him.

Kneeling down to nuzzle his head (one of many mannerisms and customs the humans took from the hyenas), she closed her eyes and took a deep breath before answering, "Yes my little hunter. But don't worry! I may find an elephant or a terror bird for food!"

Her pup smiled at her before getting up, and running over to the other pups, bone in hand, as Obah giggled at his dirt covered bottom sprinting away. "They grow up fast don't they?" Turning to the voice that spoke, she saw her mother and the camp elder, Noké, "I remember my mother telling tales of grand hunts, hunts that stopped when the hyenas arrived."

Obah sighed, "I know mama," she held back her tears, walking over to her javelin strap, making sure that she had all four before grabbing her spear as well, "you've told me many times before."

Looking at her daughter and then the horizon, Noké asked "How far are you hunting now dear daughter?"

"To the border. They somehow have plants that grow when they want, and they never seem to run short of food! If I can get some, we may yet outlast the dry season."

"Be careful daughter. Many have tried, most were eaten. I don't want your pup to join the badlands as an exile seeking blood of them for your death."

"Nor I mama." Obah said as she started her trek to the border, along the Wide Shallow River, "Especially not my pup."
13522432.title: Female Human

choices: The hyenas smell her, and look for her
The hyenas send out more hunting parties, she could steal food now...
135224322.content:
Once at the base of the hill her camp was calling home for now, Obah removed her javelin strap and, after ensuring her braid was secure and tight, rolled around in the dusty ground, camouflaging her body and masking her scent. Securing her strap once more to her person, and a quick stop to double check her water pouch, she grabbed her spear and headed off to the border, keeping low to the ground, sniffing the air and checking the ground for tracks frequently, both for food, and to avoid predators.

The sun was high, almost at the apex of its arc, and nary a beast was seen or smelled for the entire journey. By now the hot sun had caused her body to sweat off much of the dust covering her, and she knew that she'd eventually have to find another bluff where such soil was, which would be hard in unfamiliar ground, or head home empty handed. Before she decided, she took one more sniff of the air.

Smoke.

Looking upwind, she saw several pillars of smoke rising over the hillside, crouching low in the dry grass, Obah carefully crawled up the side before looking over the hill. Hyenas. Dozens of them, far outside the borders agreed upon by their chief. Not good.

The border was at least another two hours journey away, why would they journey so far south? Her answer arrived in the form of a Hyena hunting party carrying several humans on poles, food.

"Humanitarians." She growled to herself. Most hyena didn't care for a particular kind of meat, and only ate human if they broke the laws and borders agreed upon many seasons ago. Humanitarians actively hunted and ate humans, and as such were outlaws from the hut cities of their kind.

A quick count had twelve hyenas in their encampment, and her camp was only a few hours away from here! Her camp was her immediate family, including herself, only seven, and even then only three could actually hunt ... or fight. Deciding to watch the hyenas down below, Obah laid as flat as possible and settled in to observe them. If they left soon, she could resume her hunt, if they stayed, she'd have to warn her camp.

But looking at the prisoners brought another idea to mind, theft. These hyenas weren't protected by the laws nor their chief, if she could steal some of their food, she could feed her family and warn them to move in one swift stroke!

Laying on her stomach in the dirt, covered in dust, the naked huntress watched the camp below and waited to see what they would do.
135224322.title: She finds nothing on the way to the border

choices: The fight continues between Obah and the hyena
Some of Chief Thek's hyenas interrupt the fight
1352243221.content:
Laying in the grass, Obah watched as the hyenas ate their food, the pack leaders eating first, often just swallowing the humans whole, while the lower tier hyenas made do with cutting up their humans and cooking them. But as she watched them, her heart dropped when two of them seemed to look right at her, their noses sniffing eagerly.

The wind changed direction.

Obah crawled back as quickly as she could down the hill before getting up and sprinting away as fast as she could, hearing the laughing barks of her pursuers. A quick look back showed that's only three of them were chasing her, the others must've stayed to guard their food. She couldn't lead them home, her camp wouldn't stand a chance, she'd have to lead them away, or fight.

She kept running.

She wasn't in top shape, the dry season and scarcity of food had taken its toll on her, and these hyenas were eating well, turning a left at the lone tree, she led them down toward the cracked earth. Once a watering hole, now the soil was dried out, and the larger plant life dead. Drawing one of her javelins, she turned and picked the center hyena, throwing it with all her might at her target.

If his fall to the ground wasn't an indication that she hit her mark, the howl of pain was. His companions put on a burst of speed, and she could hear their footsteps beside her, deciding to stand and fight, she stopped and thrust her spear where the footsteps on her left were coming from.

The hyena grabbed her spear and pulled.

Tumbling across the ground, she scrambled to her feet, drawing another javelin as the hyena snapped her spear in half, his partner drawing his own spear.

"Come now female." The second one said, "Just die honorably feeding the superior race."

"Never." Obah spat back, ignoring the various scrapes that covered her body, "You are not superior. You are monsters."

The first hyena chuckled, "Monsters we may be, but we are still superior."

Both of them rushed her.

Thrusting her javelin as hard as she could into the hyena with the spear, she succeeded in landing her hit, but the other one tackled her, knocking the wind out of her. He pinned her arms and legs to the ground before running his snout from her navel to her throat, sniffing and occasionally licking her.

"You smell so good," he panted, "and the sweet sweat adds to the natural flavor." He laughed as he licked the side of her face, "You killed my brothers, now I eat you."

Obah glared defiantly at her enemy, "Not yet." She growled as she bent her knee as hard as she could, getting the hyena in his crotch, causing his grip to weaken, and a yelp of pain.

"You'll scream for that!" He roared as he kneed her in the belly, once again knocking the wind out of her, before bringing his mouth over her right shoulder and biting down.

Obah screamed.
1352243221.title: The hyenas smell her, and look for her

choices: Obah's pack heading to the hyena camp
Obah finds food on the way back to her pack
13522432212.content:
As Obah laid on the ground, trying to avoid looking at the gaping maw in front of her face, she heard some barks from the side, and the hyena on her was thrown off. Looking over to the source of the sound, she saw two more hyenas approaching, one drawing a javelin as he approached. Rolling over, ignoring the pain in her throwing shoulder, she crawled toward her discarded spear, and whimpered as she rolled back over, and waited for the end.

But they weren't after her.

Watching in partial shock, and partial adrenaline rush, Obah watched as the hyena who'd been on top of her, laying with a javelin sticking out of his side, was brutally ripped adapt by the new hyenas. As she inched her way back away from them, the two saw her, and after a brief conversation in their barking language, approached her.

"Are you alright?"

The voice was deep and old, and not at all aggressive, she could scarcely believe that's it came from a hyena. "Y-yes." She hissed as her shoulder gave another bolt of pain, "Justa little hurt."

The hyenas companion kneeled down as drew an herbalist pouch out of his satchel, grinding some leaves up in his massive hands before he forcibly pulled her closer and slathered her shoulder in the mix.

"Keep it easy for a few days." He said, wiping his hand so off in the dirt, "Don't need an infection."

She nodded silently, looking at the horribly mauled corpse of a hyena behind them.

The deep voiced one turned to see what she was looking at before looking back at her. "Don't worry, we're servants of Thek, not humanitarians." He gestured to his javelins, "We were actually stalking them when they started hunting you." He looked her over, and it seemed that he liked what he was looking at, "What's a lovely female like you doing out in the wilds alone?"

Obah rolled her shoulder, the herbs having numbed it, before answering, "Hunting. My pack is hungry, and my pup especially needs food." She absently rubbed the pack mark cut into her right forearm, "My mate died not too long ago, and it has been many moons since the rains."

Sharing a look with his companion, the deep voiced one turned back to Obah, "How many females in your pack? And do you serve the Five Fires?"

"Including me? Three of rutting age, my mother, one male, two pups. And we do answer to the Fires."

The hyenas smiled at this, standing up and gesturing back to the way they came from. "Though you are human, and forbidden from eating hyena, as the laws decree, our camp has much food. Bring your pack, all we ask is the right to rut with your females, it has been many nights since we last saw a female."

"If I refuse?" Obah asked, knowing to always stay cautious around hyena, no matter their behavior.

"Then we leave, and you continue on your way, and we on ours."

Standing up to her full height, her head barely reaching the belly buttons of the hyenas, Obah looked up at them, "I accept on behalf of the pack." She lifted her head up, exposing her neck and her bare body to the two large hyenas, ancient custom of the humans showing their vulnerable parts to their then masters, the hyenas.

The deep voiced one licked her neck, ending the custom, allowing her to lower her head, "We look forward to it." He rumbled, once again gesturing the direction to their camp, the two headed off, and Obah began her way back to her pack.
13522432212.title: Some of Chief Thek's hyenas interrupt the f...

choices: The Leader has sex with Obah
The Healer has sex with Obah
The Hyenas were really a rival group of Humanitarians.
135224322121.content:
"Are you sure about this?" Noke asked, as she and the rest of the group walked after Obah.

"I'm reasonably sure about it," said Obah. "They said that they were servants of Thek. After all, if they were Humanitarians, I wouldn't be here."

"I see," said Noke. "And they also helped your shoulder out."

"Yes," said Obah. "I doubt that they would have taken care of my injury if killing me was their intention."

"I've heard of stories," said Noke. "Let's hope that they keep their word. Sex for food?"

Obah nodded. "That's the deal. Me and the other of-age females have sex with them, and they'll give us food."

"Alright," said Noke. "I'll trust your judgement on this."

"I'm just hope I'm not wrong," said Obah. "I'd hate for it to have been a trap."

Soon enough, the group was at the Hyenas' camp.

"I'm here," said Obah. "We have a deal? Sex for food?"

The leader nodded. "That is the deal."
135224322121.title: Obah's pack heading to the hyena camp

choices: The next morning, Obah's pack is given the chance to travel with the hyenas
The next morning, the hyenas are gone
1352243221211.content:
Before the rutting, Noke watched as her three daughters, their remaining male, and their two pups all feasted on fresh meat, and vegetables of all things! She nervously looked up at the hyenas, the human male came up to just barely over the belly button of the hyena leader, but like Obah said, they were desperately hungry for food and a good rutting for full bellies was a fair trade. Looking at her old body, she sighed, so many memories so long ago before the rains became infrequent, her body had aged quite a bit, her teats sagged and her fur turned grey, but that was life out here.

Obah meanwhile was feeding her pup and herself while taking glances at the hyenas tents. The idea of the tent was not in the normal human pack innovations, they normally found a bluff to camp under or a cliff face or a cave. Their most recent camp was literally just leaf mats under a large tree, and a bonfire in the middle. She even saw some shiny stone looking spears that one hyena called "meh-tul", but the word wasn't one he was familiar with, humans were used to using sharpened wood and stone, why should they change their culture any more than they had to match the hyena?

Her sisters, Tetay and Ponti, were eating while being rutted. Bent over and presenting themselves to their partners, they were on their knees and elbows, stuffing their mouths with whatever food they had in reach in between moans.

"Are you ready?" Obah heard the leader ask behind her, sniffing at her neck, causing goosebumps to run across her naked body.

Swallowing the instinctual fear at being presented with a superior predator, Obah nodded, setting her pup aside to play with his cousin. "As ready as I can be."

The leader smiled and Obah's jaw almost hit the dirt, when the leader's penis was unsheathed. It was a rather impressive size.

Obah looked at her sisters, being rutted by the smaller healer and another smaller pack member, but a deal was a deal. She turned around and presented herself to the leader, getting on her knees and looking up at him over her shoulder.

The leader got on his knees too, and then, it started. She couldn't tell whether it was from pain or pleasure, but she didn't want to to get any worse, she could feel his paws/hands on her shoulders, and she barked like a female hyena. Just like her mother said to, she'd had to do this before, so Obah and her sisters listened, and obeyed.

She could feel the strength of the hyena's maleness behind each thrust. Eventually the twitching from both the leader and Obah ceased and Obah and the leader let loose primal howls that resounded across the savannah.

As the first watch began, Obah, more than a little sore, like her sisters, lay down under the stars with her pack, all the humans feeling uncomfortable under the tents since they were used to the open sky above them. Her pup cuddled up beside her, and the last she felt was the warmth of the fire, and her pup unconsciously trying to nurse from her.
1352243221211.title: The Leader has sex with Obah

choices: Obah and her group travel with Chirk and his scouts
Obah and her group head back to their encampment
13522432212111.content:
When Obah woke up, she saw the hyena leader cooking some food over a fire.

"You're welcome to join," he said. "The other's aren't up yet."

"Thanks," Obah said, as she came over to the hyena.

"Good day for traveling," the hyena said. "Our packleader will be pleased about the deaths of those Humanitarians."

"I suppose that Thek Dustpaw would be happy about that," said Obah.

The hyena nodded. "You're welcome to travel with us if you want, you and the rest of your group. There's more of your kind where we are heading. Maybe you and the rest of your group could find mates."

Obah smiled at the thought. "I suppose that would be good. I know that I could easily have a few more pups."

"Me and the rest would enjoy the company as well," the hyena said. "Maybe our next rutting could be something you're more familiar with, in the face-to-face style. To be honest, most of us prefer it in that manner."

"Oh," said Obah. "I was informed it was otherwise."

The hyena chuckled. "Of course, there's a lot of styles to use for rutting."

Obah smiled, as she remembered some of the things she and her mate used to do.

"Of course, if you don't want to travel with us, I have something for you." The hyena got something out of a pouch, and handed it to her. "Should you, or another of your group, need to travel to our encampment, or feel the need to hunt or scavenge in our territory, make sure that you wear that. It means that your a friend. When asked by another scout, tell them it was given to you by Scout Leader Chirk."

Obah looked at the item. It was a piece of metal that dangled off of a length of tough dried sinew that could be worn about the neck. The metal had a shape that looked similar to the hyenas. She put it on. "Thank you, Scout Leader Chirk."

Chirk nodded. "Of course, if you forget my name, just go along peacefully with whatever scouts that do encounter you, until I can verify things."

"Alright," said Obah. "I'll let the others of my group know."

Chirk nodded. "Good. Depending on your choice, maybe we'll get to know each other better. Failing that, may our next encounter be less of a rescue, and more that of friends greeting one another."
13522432212111.title: A Chance to Travel

135224323.content:
The sun was hot, as Obah carefully searched the area for several hours. Using her spear, she would dig in likely spots, searching for creatures that buried themselves into the ground in order to avoid the heat, along with edible roots and tubers. So far though, her search had produced nothing. Drinking sparingly from her water pouch, she then looked for something else. The heat was becoming too much for anyone to travel, but it would get cooler later, and she could travel then. She then noticed a small rock pile. She walked towards it.

When Obah got to the pile, she tapped on the sides of it, and waited for a moment. She then removed a rock, looked inside for any creatures that had escaped the heat of the day, but found nothing. She then crawled inside herself, replacing the rock. It wasn't much, but it kept her out of the sun, the wind, and many predators would have a hard time locating her. For now though, she could rest, and try to regain her energy.

A while later, something awoke her. At first, Obah wasn't sure what was different. Then, she sniffed. She could smell smoke, and meat cooking. Grabbing her spear, she listened carefully, hearing the footsteps and other sounds. Someone was outside the rock pile, someone heavy. Placing an eye against a crack, she saw a figure, a large one.

"I can hear you in there," the figure said, in a deep voice. "Come out, and share my meal, if you like. Or, stay in there, and remain hungry."

Obah felt her stomach grumble as she smelled the food again. Given that the rock pile was still intact, and that she hadn't been dragged from it to be raped, or eaten, she felt that it was possible that the stranger could be trusted not to harm her. Carefully removing the rock, she crawled out of the pile, replacing it once more. She then looked at the stranger. The hyena was a male of the
135224323.title: A Hot Search, and a Stranger

choices: "I guess you can tie me to you."
"I guess you can carry me in a pouch."
"I guess I could travel inside of your stomach."
1352243233.content:
The hyena was one of the extremely large ones, easily three to four times her size. Obah wondered if she'd of been better off to stay hidden inside of the pile, but the hyena merely indicated a spot on the other side of him, a spot that placed the fire between them. Granted, the hyena could probably, and easily, grab her in spite of the fire, but he was being polite, offering her some space.

"Thanks," Obah said, as she sat across from him. She looked at him. "Aren't you a little out of the Border for your tribe?"

"I'm Wandering," the hyena said.

Obah nodded in understanding. The hyenas, and the others like them, would have those who traveled around the Packs, looking for a place to settle down. Sometimes this took years, during which, they were the Honored Guest of those who hosted them, and thus were allowed to hunt in another Pack's territory, so long as they shared the bounty with the Host Pack, and were allowed to mate with those who stayed.

"There isn't a whole lot of your kind in this general area," Obah said. "Cross the river over in that direction, and you'll find more."

The hyena nodded. "I've lived there. But I don't want to just stay there. Might travel towards the Anubian Territories; I've heard that hunting is generally easier there."

"It is the dry season," said Obah.

The hyena chuckled. "I've noticed." He then looked at the meal. "Food's about ready." He took out a bowl, scooped some food into it, and offered it to her.

"Thanks," Obah said, as she accepted the bowl. She then began to eat the contents, just in case the hyena changed their mind. Instead, they took a second bowl, filled that, and ate from that bowl. She watched as they soon finished, and set their bowl down.

"Are you out here by yourself?" they asked.

Obah nodded. "More or less."

"Do you have a tribe nearby?" the hyena asked.

"Reasonably," said Obah. "Trying to locate food for them."

"I'm surprised that you're out here by yourself," the hyena said. "Surely most of you go out hunting with someone, just in case of danger."

Obah lowered her eyes. "My mate died half a moon ago. He fell off of a cliff while searching for bird nests."

"I'm sorry to hear that," the hyena said.

"Our pup is with my mother at the moment," said Obah. "There's only a handful of us at the moment. Others, they've drifted off in order to make hunting and gathering easier. But, we haven't had much luck."

"I might be able to help you out with that," the hyena said. "I was tracking a solitary elephant when I came across your stone pile, and decided to take a rest."

"Are you sure about the elephant?" Obah asked. There would be plenty of meat to feed her family, if she could kill one.

The hyena nodded. "It isn't too far away. Should be able to get to it before sundown."

Obah looked at the sun. Night wasn't too far off. "You sure about that?"

"Well, it's not a problem at my pace," said the hyena. "I could tie you to me, or put you in a carrying pouch, or I could carry you in my stomach. Alternatively, you could just walk alongside of me; might take a little longer though."

"And, you're just going to split the elephant with me and mine?" Obah asked.

"Most of it would go to waste otherwise," said the hyena. "You interested?"

"Yes, I'm interested," said Obah. "Don't know what I can offer you for your help though."

The hyena chuckled. "I can think of something. I'm not too picky about my temporary mates."

Obah looked at herself. She then looked at the hyena. "Well, I have been curious about what it would be like to mate with one of your kind."

"Good," the hyena said. "My name is Reze. What's yours?"

"Obah."

Reze nodded. "So, how do you want to travel?"

Obah thought for a moment and said...
1352243233.title: Assault Type Hyena

choices: Another tribe of humans is also hunting the elephant.
Another group of Hyenas is also hunting the elephant.
13522432331.content:
"I think I'd rather walk," said Obah. "We've only just met."

Reze chuckled. "I understand. You at least want a chance to escape, in case I prove to be untrustworthy."

"Right," said Obah.

"I'm agreeable to this," said Reze. He indicated her bowl. "Do you want some more before we go hunting?"

She looked at her bowl. It was empty. "I'm good for now. Don't want to eat too much and have a long walk to face. Besides, we'll need to drive the elephant towards my tribe's home."

"Alright," said Reze. He grabbed his large spear, along with his provisions and stood up.

Obah did the same as Reze kicked sand and dirt on the fire. "Time to hunt."
13522432331.title: "I'd rather walk."

choices: Obah goes and gathers her pack to help carve up the meat and gather the blood
Reze demands first picks of the meat and the blood
135224323311.content:
Walking, well more like jogging, next to a hyena several times her size was not how Obah saw this hunt going, she was sure she'd end up either empty-pawed, or dead in a humanitarians stomach. Looking up at Reze, she wondered what it was like to be a hyena, with the knowledge of building and the magic that allows them to grow plants as they need. Shaking her head, she waved away such thoughts, as a servant of the Five Fires, she was dedicated to preserving the human way of life, as long as humans lived, they should live as they do now.

"I have a question." Reze asked, startling Obah into looking up at him.

"Yes?" She asnswered tenetively, preparing to try and fight for her life if need be.

"Why do you all live so primitively?" Reze gestured to her body, "We do not wear clothes as we have fur, yet you do not, and go naked like us."

Obah shrugged, "Its the way the Fires decree we are to live, we share some cultural traits and terms, and preserve what we can of our way of life." She looked out a thing the horizon, "If it's a harder life then so be it."

Reze debated if he should tell her just how much of the human culture was actually from his people, but decided against it, it'd only end badly for her. "I see." Was all he said, before looking up and sniffing the wind, "The elephant is near, which way to drive him?"

Obah pointed over toward the rocks in the distance, "There."

Nodding, Reze dropped to all fours, "Start heading there, and ready your up your spear." And then he took off far faster than anything Obah had ever seen before, getting behind the elephant and driving him toward the rocks.

Sprinting as fast as she could, Obah managed to get into position and readied up her spear, holding her extras in her left hand, watching as he nipped at the heels of the elephant, driving him closer.

Finally upon the rocks, Obah jumped up and threw her first spear straight at the elephants left eye, causing the elephant to cry out in pain, thrashing wildly, before Reze appeared and drove his own massive spear up into the chest of the elephant.

"Wow." Was all Obah had to say at the raw strength she just witnessed.
135224323311.title: The hunt goes well.

choices: Later, Obah's pack feasts, and tells stories to their Guest
Later, Obah seeks out Reze for her part of their bargain
During the butchering of the elephant
While heading back to the elephant
On her way to her Pack
1352243233111.content:
"I'm going to get my pack, so that we can carve up the meat," said Obah. "This should sustain us for at least a few weeks."

"I hope that you don't mind if I make my selections while you're going to get them?" Reze asked.

Obah laughed. "Go ahead. It was your spear that killed it. You can have what you want. There's more than enough to share."

Reze chuckled. "In that case, wait a moment, before you go." He took out a large, to Obah, knife, and cut the elephant open. The hyena reached inside of the slain beast, and pulled something out.

Obah looked at what Reze has pulled out, the elephant's heart. To consume it was to consume some of the beast's strength. It was bigger than her head!

Reze offered it to her. "You can have the first bite."

Obah smiled. "If nothing else, you are a polite guest." She bit into the large organ. It was very tasty, especially given she hadn't eaten much in the last few days.

Reze chuckled. "I'm glad you approve." He tossed the rest into his mouth, and swallowed.

"I'll be back in a bit," said Obah.
1352243233111.title: A Fellow Hunter's Gift

choices: "Obah and I have a mating to do first"
"But of course!" (Follow through with Obah after celebrating)
13522432331113.content:
When Obah returned with her pack, the few adults immediately started helping to carve up the elephant, while the pups were situated off to the side and watched by the matriarch, Noke, Obah's mother. The blood was gathered up in sacred pouches for their ceremonies, Reze had already carved out a large portion of the elephant for himself, so he mostly watched from a short distance off.

"Interesting." He muttered to himself, watching as the humans were stripping the elephant down to the bone bit by bit, chuckling a bit as Obah carved off the elephants penis and testicals before clumsily carrying them over to him.

"As our guest, and the head hunter," Obah lifted her haul to him, "we offer you the genitals of the elephant, so that your virility can be enhanced, in honor of your service to us."

Reze smiled, this was a little unexpected, but not unwelcome, so he nodded and lifted the gift from her, before wrapping it up and covering it in the preservative spices. "Many thanks, perhaps this gift will aid me in siring many pups."

Obah nodded and headed back to her pack, who'd mostly finished with the meat and was working on getting the more useful bones out, the ones that could be used for weapons or tools.

Reze noticed that her pack was small, including Obah and the pups, it only had seven members with only a single adult male for all of them. 'The dry season must be even harder on them' he thought to himself, where the hyenas had farming and the hut cities, the humans lived under trees or at the bases of large hills to block the wind and sparse rains. It seemed that the arrival of the hyenas had more or less frozen this group of humans development, leaving them stuck at a very primitive hunter-gatherer level, with an almost religious approach to lighting a fire.

Noke approached Reze slowly, "Great hyena, will you be joining us for the hunt celebration tonight?"

Reze replied......

135224323311132.content:
"Of course," said Reze. "I am honored to be included."

Noke looked over at her daughter. "Obah has told me that part of the price for the elephant was the privilege to mate with her."

"Figured that you and your tribe would get better use out of the elephant than just myself," said Reze. "Most would have gone to waste otherwise. As for mating with your daughter, it does get lonely Wandering around. This way, we'd both get something useful."

"I trust that you have prior experience mating with humans?" Noke asked, a certain amount of concern in her voice.

Reze chuckled. "I'll be careful. She might be a little sore afterwards, but she will be fine. She wouldn't be the first human I've mated with."

Noke breathed a sigh of relief. "One hears of things, even those who live the way we do."

"You have my word," said Reze. "If she changes her mind, or feels too much pain, I'll stop before things go too far."

"Good," said Noke. "Otherwise I'll cut your genitals off."

Reze grinned. "No wonder your tribe has survived."
135224323311132.title: A Mother's Concerns

choices: Reze finds the celebration odd and unusual
1352243233111322.content:
As the adults continued to carve up the elephant, Reze noticed that the human pups were looking at him in curiosity, peeking over a nearby rock. Chuckling to himself, he waved them over, remembering to keep his ears relaxed and not show teeth so as not to scare any of the pups or adults. The trio of pups slowly approached him, two males and a female, he noted.

"Why're you so big?" The lead boy asked, leaning back to look at Reze's face.

"Because I am, the same reason for why the sun is hot."

"My momma told me she might get an elephant today hunting," the boy continued, "did she need your help?"

'This must be Obah's pup' he thought to himself, and opted to make her sound far tougher and more vital to the hunt, he also felt like brushing up on his storytelling, "Well you see pup, your mother found the elephant tracks and invited me along for the hunt...."

Obah, her sister, her sisters mate, and her mother were all tired and covered in sweat after stripping the elephant, the sun had started to set, so Noke had gone off to get the fire and move it here for the celebration of the hunt. Looking over to where the pups last were, she panicked when she didn't see them, looking everywhere along the horizon until she heard the pups 'oohing', turning quickly, she saw Reze telling the some story.

"And just before the elephant could crush me, Obah charged at it, jumping off of me and grabbing the elephant by its face! She thrust her spear into its eye and turned it away from me, yelling for me to stab its heart....."

Smiling, Obah realized he was telling them the story of the hunt, but changed to make her a far fiercer hunter than she was. She wasn't sure what she was expecting from him, but this definitely wasn't it. As Hok (the lone male) started prepping some of the elephant meat for when Noke returned, Obah and her sister started drawing the ceremonial celebratory markings across their bodies in the elephants blood. The ornate lines and swirls covered them from head to toe, with the exception of their breasts, crotch and buttocks, which had hand prints over each.

"My little hunter!" Obah called, "Come here!" Her son nodded, waving at Reze before coming over and letting his mother cover his body in similar markings, his cousins getting the same treatment from their mother and father.
1352243233111322.title: Those few children get curious about Reze

choices: "I'd like to sleep next to you."

13522432331113223.content:
After the celebration, which seemed to consist of the humans jumping in circles around the fire, Reze lay a bit of a distance from the rest of Obah's pack, watching them get ready to go to sleep themselves. He didn't understand the reason behind the ceremony, but decided not to say anything about it, as it wasn't anything too crazy. After all, it was nothing like what some of the humans did in the territories of certain packs where the local Wolves were worshiped like they were living Gods or whatever - sometimes those humans offered themselves up as meals to the Wolves. While Reze had eaten human flesh before, including a few who had been very sick and/or were already dead or dying, he wasn't sure what he'd do if a healthy human just offered themselves up as a meal.

His ears perked up as he heard Obah coming over to him.

"Did you like the celebration?" she asked.

"It was alright," Reze said.

"There's a lot of spirits watching over us up there," said Obah, as she looked up.

"It's one way of putting it," said Reze. He knew what she was talking about, the lights of gas visible in the night sky. He briefly wondered what his kind must have thought about them themselves, before the Abductors had turned such superstitions into nightmares.

"It's said that they can help one find their way," said Obah.

"They have patterns one can use for traveling," said Reze. "They differ somewhat in different areas."

"I suppose that's good to know," said Obah, as she got close to Reze. "I'd hate to get lost."

"Know the feeling," said Reze. "My people were lost for a while, and some say that we still are." Reze looked over at Obah. "So, what do you wish to do?"

Obah looked at him, and said....
13522432331113223.title: After the Celebration

He had her lay on her back
135224323311132231.content:
"It was the deal that I should mate with you after the hunt," Obah said slowly, looking at his sheath with a touch of apprehension, "and a deal is a deal."

Reze was not surprised at her apprehension, he was much larger than the humans around him, and the pack was still a little wary of him, except for the pups, of course. "I was wondering when I should approach you about our deal." He said as he adjusted to get more comfortable, "Any questions before we begin?"

Obah shook her head, "No."

Reze nodded, and watched Obah get into what he'd assumed was the standard mating position for the humans, on all fours and her rear facing him. As glad as he was that she was honoring their deal, the Hyenas did not mate like this, and it was odd to see such a position. "Come here, I shall show you how we mate." He said, offering his hand to her as she stood up and faced him.

Obah nodded, and took his hand as...
135224323311132231.title: "I'd like to fulfill our deal."

choices: Obah wants Reze to stay with them to help hunt
Reze wants to take them to the hyena cities to help them get food
1352243233111322311.content:
Obah felt strange straddling Reze's lap, looking at his massive chest, she briefly wondered exactly how this was going to work, he was much larger than a human after all. Reze just smiled and she suddenly felt him prod her, and as she fell into his rhythm, despite the overly large size, it wasn't that bad.

Reze watched the human bouncing up and down on his member, letting loose howls and cries of pleasure, she sounded close to a wolf, but the vocal chords were all wrong, so it sounded just off enough to know that she was human. He supposed that terms and gestures weren't the only things that humans hadn't borrowed from the wolves, they'd copied their mating instincts as well.

Obah tried to keep her head clear as she mated with Reze, but the waves of discomfort had given way to pleasure, and she lost herself in the motions, and after a time, she was stretched out on his torso, sound asleep.

Reze, not wanting to wake Obah, lay out on the ground, watching the stars and reflecting on the last few days, the dry season was tough this year, no rain in five moons now. He glanced at the small human pack, if it continued any longer, they'd start to get desperate, and so would the hyenas, no matter how much food they'd grown or stockpiled.

But that was a matter for the next day.

1352244.content:
Okami Lang Nation
Leader: Mori Tenno Huangdi
Numbers: 150,000 wolves, 800,000 humans (various positions)
Info: Inhabiting quite a bit of what is now East Asia, such as China and Japan, among others, the Okami Lang Nation prides itself on having well-trained, and disciplined fighters. Surprising enough, the wolves are very tolerant of the humans in their territory, and it is not unheard of for humans to even hold command over wolves in certain situations. On rare occasions, humans are even adopted into the families of the wolves.

Col Gerroks
Leader: None or Many
Numbers: 50,000 wolves, 70,000 humans
Info: Inhabiting what is known as the Middle East, the Col Gerroks mainly wander through the deserts of the area, traveling in small groups, usually under a few hundred in number. The harshness of the land ensures cooperation, and it is not unheard of for the wolves to act as an improvised shelter for the humans during windstorms, one way or another. While generally helpful to those in need of aid, those who steal food and water are often dealt with harshly, as they are forced to wander alone, with no supplies. Those who commit murder or rape, are killed on sight, and the bodies of wolf murderers/rapists are left to rot, while the human ones are eaten by the wolves that they wronged, or are friends of humans that they wronged.

Outback Dingoes
leader: None or Many
Numbers: 7,500 Dingoes, 30,000 humans
Info: Possibly the smallest of the Major Packs, the Outback Dingoes live in what is known as Australia. The Dingoes tend to wander the land, moving from place to place. Generally peaceful, they won't hesitate to protect those they are friends with. Groups usually have a Dingo as a leader, although it isn't unheard of for humans to be leaders.
1352244.title: Other

13522444.content:
The Sea Dogs
leader: Viktor Bludflagge
Numbers: 12,500 wolves , 2,500 humans(few survive the "initiation")
Info: The sea dogs are a large fleet of pirate ships that roam the Atlantic ocean, all under the command of a figure known as the "Supreme Marshal". While they spend most of their time at sea, they have control over a few small islands in the Atlantic ocean that they use for resupplying and reorganizing. They raid anyone who tries passing through their territory, and as such they have made an enemy out of all other packs. They value strength and cunningness above everything else, in order to become the Supreme Marshal one must defeat the previous one in combat. Humans rarely survive the brutal initiation ritual, and even then they usually get a lowly job. There are exceptions through, a good example is the current Supreme Marshal, Viktor Bludflagge.

(Made by EggzSupreme (10) )
The Pride
leader: Chief Tembe
Numbers: 50,000 lions, 10,000 humans (playthings)
Info: Strangely enough some of the tribes evolved feline like features. Extremely territorial and aggressive, this tribe's culture, society and traditions are entirely based on dominating lesser creatures such as humans. Humans who trespass in their territory are often sentenced to a lifetime of servitude and humiliation as either public property or the alpha lion's personal playthings. Many human tribes send out their own villages as tributes in order to avoid the lion's wrath, rarely do such tributes stop the lions from raiding for more playthings


(Made by Owner)
Lore Keepers
Leader: None
Numbers: Unknown - around 1,000 total
Info: Lore Keepers are the society's historians. Known only as Lore Keeper, it is their job to write down everything a pack does. Any pack would be proud to have one, so that future generations would know what they did. They are to be impartial in all things, although they can give out advice to those who need it. Regardless of what occurs, a Lore Keeper writes what happens down, even when they personally disagree with what occurs. That being said, it is considered bad luck to harm a Lore Keeper, for it is said that they can erase one from existence, even removing their name from peoples' memory, as if they were nothing. While the truth of this claim is in doubt, Lore Keepers write harshly of those who do harm to a Lore Keeper, portraying them in a less than friendly manner.

Which are you?

13522444121.content:
"Wait, so you're telling me that our captain Viktor, a regular human, defeated Big Mack, an Assault Genotype Wolf?" asked a patrolling wolf to his partner.

"Yes i know it sounds weird but everyone i ask on this ship tell me the same thing, Viktor apparently defeated a 18 foot tall wolf in fair combat no less." answered the other wolf.

"it just... doesn't add up. Can you please help me wrap my head around that?" he muttered in confusion.

"Say boys, What are ye two chattin' about?"

Both wolves froze. It was the captain, Viktor Bludflagge himself had overheard them, and they were too busy slacking off their guard duty to notice him coming over.

"N-nothing Mr. Bludflagge, we were't talking about anything!" the first wolf said frantically.

"That's Captain Bludflagge to you! If you two nimrods have the guts ta say something behind my back, then yer brave enough to say it to my face! So speak up, before i have ya thrown overboard, fer the sharks to enjoy..." yelled Viktor.

"Y-yes Captain Bludflagge! Me and my friend here just wanted to hear the story of how you defeated Big Mack." the second wolf said, trying to cover up their tracks.

"Ahhhh, why didn't ya just say so boy! Ain't nothing shameful in wanting to be educated. Anyways here i go." the captain said as he cleared his throat.

"So, a long time ago, i managed to survive the initiation and got a job as a lowly janitor. Back then there was a mountain of a wolf called "Big Mack" who was the captain and Supreme Marshal of tha sea dogs. He might have had the size advantage but i had something he never had! I had ambitions, determination and a rusty dagger..." Viktor said.

The captain took a drink from his trusty canteen before he continued the story. "Picture this, a young, lowly human janitor challenges a wolf three times as big as him. Funny picture right? At least old Mack thought it was, tha big bastard laughed his ass off for a solid minute. He was so slow and had the reflexes of a dead whale! He had barelly started swinging his great big cutlass when i lunged for him. Ya should have seen tha surprised look on his face when i sunk me dagger in his big fat belly!"

The captain started laughing hysterically, while the two wolves were listening in disbelief. "So anyways, Tha big bastard just fell on the ground and bled ta death shortly after. On that day i was crowned the new Supreme Marshal and i became captain of this here fine vessel. Even got this nice, custom made hat. From that day forward any wolf brave enough to challenge me has ended up with his insides on the outside! So don't be getting any smart ideas, and get back ta work! Ya lazy gobshites..."

"Yes captain!" the wolves said in sync, then they resumed their guard duty.

The captain silently swayed his head in disappointment. Did these two idiots really pass initiation? If so, he ought to make it even harder. While he was busy devising new ways to test recruits he ran into an assault genotype wolf with a missing eye.

"Oi Finn! You know tha two new recruits?" Viktor asked.

"You mean the two recon types, Vinny and Lyn?" the large wolf replied.

"Yeah them. Do me a favor and roughen them up a bit will ya? They ought ta learn to not question authority." Viktor said.

"Aye, aye Captain." answered Finn as he went off to search for the two unfortunate wolves.

Bludflagge smiled. Finn was as big, hardened son of a bitch, and he was as loyal as they come. He couldn't dream for a better right hand wolf. He then resumed his inspection of the ship and the crew. After he checked every bit of his prized vessel he went back to his quarters. When Big Mack died and Viktor became the new captain he found the current captains quarters to be far too big to be usable by a human.

So he had the whole room destroyed and refurnished to his liking. He sat in his comfy chair, lifted his boots on his desk and he lit up a cigar.

"Damn it's good to be the captain." he said to himself

but the tranquility was soon interrupted, as someone knocked on the door.

In came the assault genotype wolf, he had to crouch down in order to enter the room and even then he wasn't able to fully stand up inside, being forced to slouch down awkwardly.

Finn chuckled and said " Anyways, i got something important to tell you captain..."

"Well... you see..."

"You know Wilson right? He's our cook, turns out he's been stealing money from the treasury." Finn said

"He's been doing what?" Bludflagge yelled. He may be a cheating, thieving asshole but if there was ever a thing to make him turn red from anger that's having his riches stolen.

"Finn..." Bludflagge said, trying to keep his cool. "Tell me exactly what happened."

"So i was at the bar, drinking away when i noticed some of the crew had huddled up on one table. When i came over to see what's going on I found our chef, piss drunk, boasting how he stole money from the treasury." Finn explained. "So I had Amelia check our stash and she confirmed that there was in fact a large sum of money missing."

Bludflagge was really staring to loose his cool. Not only was the dumb bastard bold enough to steal from the captain's gold, but he also had to boast to the other crew members. Bludflagge took a deep breath, and said.

"Okay, First off. Where's the dirty rat right now?"

"Well once I was sure he stole, I shoved him in one of the holding cells. Wasn't too hard, he was too drunk to retaliate." Finn answered.

"The two rookies from earlier had been guarding since the last check up, so it was most likely them." Finn said.

Finn nodded and exited the room. A few minutes later he came back, hauling a chubby, basic infantry genotype in cuffs. When he put the wolf down it became apparent to Bludflagge that the alcohol had worn out, and the poor wolf was scared shitless, his knees shaking, sweating profusely. I would have had Finn roughen you up a little and after i substracted the stolen money from your pay we would have been square. But ya had to go around bragging to the other crewmates, ya had to make them question my abilities as a leader. I need to make an example, and you my boy, will be that example."

135224441211123.content:
"I'm thinking of having the Sea Dogs go into the Northern Seas, and raid those territories belonging to Winter's Children," said Bludflagge. "I'm going to need some proper clothes for the colder weather up that way. Problem is, I don't have any that would keep me warm like your fur does. Of course, since this cook won't be needing his anymore, please remove it from him."

"Captain! Please, don't skin me alive!" Wilson begged.

"I was merely going to have you shaved before we had you tossed overboard, with a nice rock tied to each of your limbs, but thank you for the suggestion," said Bludflagge. "Finn. See to it that he's skinned alive. Make sure that the whole crew is watching the execution."

"No, captain, I'll do anything!" Wilson begged. "Spare my life!"

"I would have thought about doing so if you had some sort of useful talent, like detecting poison in my food, or slipping it into that of my foes," said Bludflagge. "But you don't, and you showed just how foolish of a thief you were by bragging about it within earshot of the rest of the crew. I have to make an example out of you. Enjoy what life you have left. Finn, I want you to start work on my outfit at sunrise tomorrow. I want something for my entire body - head, face, upper body, arms, hands, lower body, legs, and feet. Also, there should be plenty of material to spare, so, don't worry too much. Get the Tanner and seamstress to work on it with you."

"Yes Captain," said Finn. "You'd certainly look like one of us."

"So long as I can handle the Northern weather," said Bludflagge.

"But Cap-"

Finn slammed a fist down on the cook's head, knocking him out.

"At least he'll be quiet for a while," said Bludflagge. "Find someone to be the new cook, someone smart enough not to steal from me, or at least not boast about stealing from me, and get me Amelia."

"Yes captain," said Finn. He looked at the unconscious ex-cook. "He was never that much of a cook anyways."

"Try to get someone who has traveled in the Okami Lang territories, and is familiar with their methods of cooking," said Bludflagge. "I've been meaning to try some of that."

"As you wish, captain," said Finn. He the left the room, dragging Wilson with him, and closing the door.

Bludflagge relighted his cigar. He hated executing people, but sometimes an example had to be made.

A while later....

1352244412111233.content:
Bludflagge heard footsteps at the door. Reaching for a knife he called out, "That you Finn?"

The door opened, and in came a figure, cloaked in white cloth.

Bludflagge relaxed a bit. It was that Lore Keeper. Bludflagge never could figure out the strange wolf, whose pack had declared themselves neutral in any decision a pack leader made, merely writing down what occurred, yet would offer advice, and criticism.

The Lore Keeper had been on a ship heading for Okami Lang Nation territories, until Bludflagge's pirates took it over. While the other passangers and crew had fetched a handsome price in ransom, in terms of precious metals, gems, food, water, medicines, and other needed things, the Lore Keeper had chosen to stay with the Sea Dogs, as the pirates didn't already have a Lore Keeper.

In some ways, Bludflagge found him to be annoying, as the Lore Keeper wrote down everything, and yet did nothing himself. The Lore Keeper would speak to him without any fear of what could happen to him, for there were laws that even Bludflagge was forced to follow, namely being that no harm was to come to a Lore Keeper. It was said that they could erase ones' very name from history, along with everything they'd ever done. Bludflagge didn't know if this was true, but he'd heard stories about those who had done wrong to one - such people ended up being written as if they were villains, and worse. Thus, the Lore Keeper was to be treated with respect.

Yet, at the same time, the Lore Keeper was a fountain of information. Lore Keepers shared what they'd written with each other, and they knew the histories of the other packs, and how different pack leaders had acted in similar situations, even before their kind had ended up upon this world, although the information prior to the Abduction was, much to their regret, somewhat fragmented. Still, knowing how another pack leader had once acted was useful.

"What do you want to know?" Bludflagge asked, as he looked at the Lore Keeper, who was of the Basic Infantry Genotype.

The Lore Keeper sat in a chair. "To know why you are having the cook executed instead of just having him beaten, like you do most thieves."

"The fact that he stole from my treasury isn't good enough?" Bludflagge asked.

"I could put that down, if you wish," the Lore Keeper said. "Although, that would just portray you as being a greedy pirate, who wants wealth for himself. A good enough reason, however, might just paint you as just being a strict leader, who cares about the well-being of his pack."

Bludflagge looked at him. "What do you think?"

"What I think isn't important," said the Lore Keeper. "My job is to write the history of our kind. What you think, as leader of the Sea Dogs, is important. After all, not many packs are lead by a human."

"I see," said Bludflagge. "In that case, how about:

13522444121112332.content:
At that moment, there was a knock on the door.

"Captain, it's me."

"Ah, Finn, do come in," said Bludflagge.

The Assault-Genotype came in, dragging a human female with him.

Bludflagge looked at the human. "By your clothes, I'd have to say that you're from the Okami Lang Nation. Are you a cook?"

The woman kept quiet.

Bludflagge looked at her. "It's a simple question."

The woman looked at him, defiance in her eyes. "Why should I answer filth such as you?"

Bludflagge grinned. "You have courage, that's one thing I like about the Okami Lang humans. Those of the IronClaw, I actually feel sorry for them, especially those of the household of General Vvulf, and I don't try to bother ransoming them back to that pack. But this Mori Tenno Huangdi, he's rather tolerant, and will even buy IronClaw humans off of my pack, although so would any other pack for that matter. I used to be part of the IronClaw pack, and I was always afraid of displeasing my master. Then I got picked up by Sea Dog raiders, and while it was harsh for me at first, I eventually became Pack Leader. You could become someone important to in this pack, making sure that my meals are safe, listening for plots against me. There might be other benefits as well."

"I only serve Lord Mori Hidyashu," the woman said. "I would never serve the likes of you."

Bludflagge looked at Finn. "One of our newest captives, right? The Emperor's own son."

Finn nodded. "Same ship we got her on."

"Good, invite him to dine with me," said Bludflagge. "Having him be my guest ought to keep her from trying to poison me."

The look on the woman's face became neutral.

"Is he a good master?" Bludflagge asked.

"Yes, but he'd rather die if that meant that you'd be dying with him."

Bludflagge chuckled. "Would you be willing to die as well?"

"If that's what it took to bring you down, so be it," the woman said.

"Have someone keep an eye on her as she prepares the meal," said Bludflagge. "If she attempts to poison me, regardless of it it is successful or not, see to it that Lord Mori Hidyashu dies a vicious death, with her watching. After that, toss her into the sea, with a rock tied to each of her limbs." He looked at the woman. "Your Lord's fate is now in your hands." He then looked at Finn. "After you've sent her to the kitchen, come back here, with Amelia. I have important business to discuss that I wish for you to hear."

"Yes Captain."

A moment later, Bludflagge was alone with the Lore Keeper.

"Harsh much?" the Lore Keeper asked.

"She is of an enemy pack, and would have reason to want me dead," said Bludflagge.

"Captured in a raid."

"She was."

"But now you're the leader of the pack."

"You're talking about me, and not her?" Bludflagge asked, looking at the Lore Keeper.

The Lore Keeper wrote on his pad. "Of course. I could talk to her and Lord Mori Hidyashu later about what they think about you. But knowing your story, that is important. We were about to discuss your prior cook."

"Yes, we were," Bludflagge said, just as he door knocked. "Who is it?"

"It's us!"

"Come in Finn, Amelia."

Bludflagge watched as Amelia came in. She was an Infiltrator Genotype, his Accountant and next to Finn in the chain of command, as well as his lover, and there were times that he was her meal.

"Good," he said. "Close the door. I don't want the others to hear this." As he did, he gave off a careful gesture.

Amelia and Finn nodded, and closed the door, but left a barely open crack, perfect for any eavesdropper to listen through.

"The reason I'm having the cook executed is thus..

"It's about Amelia," said Finn.

Bludflagge chuckled as he heard the accountant's name. "What about her? Did you catch her stealing from the treasury?"

"Well, no, although I suspect that she does skim a bit of it off the top," said Finn.

Bludflagge nodded. "I know she does. Still, she's smart enough not to brag about it, and she has uses that more than make up for the little bit she does steal from me."

Finn grinned. "I know quite a bit about one of them." He tapped his nose. "Your scents are on the other quite often."

Bludflagge grinned. "She's real good in bed."

"She is an Infiltrator-type," said Finn. "Which form do you like to take her as?"

"Both," said Bludflagge. "She has quite the lovely human form."

"Of course, it's not just the scents of sex that I've smelt on her, or you," said Finn.

The two looked at each other.

"What else do you think that we do?" Bludflagge asked.

"Um, do you trust her enough to let you out of her stomach?" Finn asked.

"I trust her enough not to kill me without a good reason," said Bludflagge. "After all, for her to be captain, she'd need a strong right hand to help her maintain control of the crew, and I'm fairly certain that you'd kill her if she killed me in anything other than a fair fight."

"Or at least one that looked fair," said Finn. "I know she puts something in the wine of those who Challenge you, something that keeps them from healing, so that you can cut them open, causing them to bleed to death."

Bludflagge looked at Finn. "You sure about that?"

Finn grinned. "No, but I'm very good at guessing, and putting things together." He then looked at a wall, one that had the heads of those who had Challenged Bludflagge for the command of the Sea Dogs. "That being said, I have no desire to be in charge, save in an emergency where you are otherwise unable to command."

"So, you don't mind being Number 2 to a human?" Bludflagge asked.

"I am loyal to you to the death," said Finn. "Anything you say, I'll do. I'll never forget the kindness you showed me, back when I was locked up for questioning Big Mack's orders, and he forbade anyone to give me water for seven days. You shoved that mop bucket within my reach, allowing me to get enough water to survive. I am yours for that reason." He got down upon his knees, and touched his head to the floor.

Bludflagge looked at Finn, and relaxed a bit. "Do get up Finn. I believe you."

Finn got back up, being careful not to hit his head.

"Now, what's this about Amelia?" Bludflagge asked.

"Well, it's like this, Captain.....
